attributes.action: A referendum on the United Kingdom's continuing membership of the E.U
attributes.additional_details:
The British people have been promised a referendum on E.U. membership, but this has never taken place.
This promise should be honoured and we should be given the right to rule our own country, make our own laws, and be released from the constraints of the E.U.
This is our democratic right, to enable Britain to deal with the problems that beset the U.K., many of which are due to rulings that have been forced upon us by unelected leaders in Brussels. We could then put the hopes and aspirations of the British people at the top of the agenda, instead of at the bottom.
